intro: Hemidesmas plenus, commonly known as the full-headed hemidesmas, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange composite flowers that bloom in late summer and early autumn. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Hemidesmas plenus is often found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and forest edges.
